On her wedding day, rice went into her left ear and when the doctor tried to take it out, he punctured her eardrum. Then she was deaf in both ears. English: Juliette Gordon Low was sick often while growing up and lost her hearing in her right ear. On her wedding day, rice went into her left ear and when the doctor tried to take it out, he punctured her eardrum. Then she was deaf in both ears. English: Corruption

English: Whilst the Fraud Act (2006) (the Act) does not provide a single definition of fraud, it may be described as theft with deception
Gloss_Translation: FRAUD ACT TWO ZERO ZERO SIX DEFINITION FRAUD' NOT THERE DESCRIBE THEFT NMF:CHEATDECEPTION POSSIBLE

English: The key characteristics of fraud include an individual acting dishonestly with the expectation of either making a gain for themselves or another person, or causing a loss to a third party
Gloss_Translation: FRAUD CHARACTERISTIC DECEIVE NMF:INDIVIDUAL NOT HONEST WHY PERSON GAIN SELF OR OTHER PERSON OR CAUSE THIRD PARTY LOSS

English: The act identifies fraud as a single offence which can be committed in three separate ways:
Gloss_Translation: FRAUD ACT IDENTIFY SINGLE OFFENCE COMMIT THREE DIFFERENT WAY POSSIBLE

English: A person dishonestly makes a false representation, intending to make a gain for himself or another, or to cause loss to another or to expose another to a risk of loss
Gloss_Translation: #VALUE!

English: The legal definition of representation is broad and includes written, verbal and non-verbal communication
Gloss_Translation: LEGAL DEFINITION REPRESENTATION BROAD INCLUDE VERBAL WRITE NON-VERBAL COMMUNICATION

English: A person dishonestly fails to disclose to another person information which he is under a legal duty to disclose, and Intends, by failing to disclose the information to make a gain for himself or another, or to cause loss to another or to expose another to a risk of loss
Gloss_Translation: INFORMATION PERSON LEGAL DUTY DISCLOSE PERSON NOT HONEST FAIL ALSO INTEND GAIN SELF ALSO OTHER ALSO CAUSE LOSS OTHER ALSO RISK EXPOSE LOSS

English: A person occupies a position in which he is expected to safeguard, or not to act against, the financial interests of another person dishonestly abuses that position, and intends, by means of abuse of that position to make a gain for himself or another, or to cause loss to another or to expose another to a risk of loss
Gloss_Translation: POSITION PERSON OCCUPY PERSON SAFEGUARD FINANCIAL INTEREST OTHER PERSON NOT HONEST ABUSE POSITION ALSO INTEND ABUSE POSITION GAIN SELF ALSO OTHER ALSO LOSS CAUSE OTHER ALSO EXPOSE OTHER RISK LOSS

English: Under the Bribery Act 2010, bribery can be committed by individuals under two main offence categories:
Gloss_Translation: BRIBERY ACT TWO ZERO ONE ZERO, BRIBERY INDIVIDUAL TWO MAIN OFFENCE CATEGORY COMMIT POSSIBLE

English: Offering, or paying a bribe to induce or reward improper duty, or knowing that acceptance of the bribe would in itself be improper performance
Gloss_Translation: BRIBE OFFER PAY IMPROPER DUTY REWARD ACCEPT KNOW IMPROPER PERFORM

English: Requesting, agreeing to receive, or receiving a bribe intending that as a consequence improper duty would be performed, or knowing that acceptance of the bribe is in itself improper
Gloss_Translation: BRIBE REQUEST RECEIVE AGREE ACCEPT INTEND IMPROPER PERSON KNOW BRIBE IMPROPER BUT CARRY-ON ACCEPT

English: In both instances, the bribe is intended to influence performance of a function, which may be carried out before, at the same time, or after the bribe is paid
Gloss_Translation: FOR EXAMPLE BOTH SAME TIME AFTER OR BEFORE BRIBE PERSON INFLUENCE SOMEONE TO PERFORMANCE FUNCTION INTEND

English: Bribes can take many forms including cash, holidays, event tickets, meals etc
Gloss_Translation: BRIBES PERSON HAND-COUNT WHAT CASH HOLIDAY EVENT TICKET MEAL BRIBE

English: Decisions could relate to, among others, recruitment, the award of contracts, planning consents and other awards
Gloss_Translation: BRIBES PERSON RECRUITMENT CONTRACT PLANNING CONSENT OTHER CHOICES DECIDE

English: The bribe may be paid directly, or via third parties
Gloss_Translation: BRIBE PAY-YOU DIRECT OR OTHER PERSON

English: A local authority is deemed a commercial organisation which can commit an offence of failing to prevent bribery
Gloss_Translation: PLACE-POINT-RIGHT LOCAL AUTHORITY COMMERCIAL ORGANISATION OFFENCE COMMITT CONSIDER WHY BRIBERY THEY PREVENT FAIL

English: It is only possible to defend such an allegation if the council has put in place adequate procedures designed to prevent persons associated with it from undertaking such conduct
Gloss_Translation: PLACE-POINT-RIGHT COUNCIL PROCEDURES ADEQUATE DOCUMENT PUT-ON MAKE SURE PERSON CONDUCT INVOLVE ALLEGATION DEFEND POSSIBLE PREVENT

English: The council, or third parties representing the council will neither accept nor offer bribes to contractors, suppliers or customers and should act with integrity at all times
Gloss_Translation: PLACE-POINT-RIGHT COUNCIL PEOPLE PLACE-POINT-LEFT CONTRACTOR SUPPLIER OR CUSTOMER THEIR OFFER NOT ACCEPT ALSO INTEGRITY ALWAYS SHOW

English: Theft is defined in the 1968 Theft Act as:

English: a person shall be guilty of theft if they dishonestly appropriate property belonging to another with the intention of permanently depriving the other of it
Gloss_Translation: PROPERTY OTHER PERSON NOT HONEST APPROPRIATE INTENTION PERMANENT DEPRIVE THEFT PERSON GULITY

English: We seek to maintain a culture which acknowledges its fraud bribery and theft risks, the processes to be adopted in the event of fraud and publicising the results of fraud investigations

Gloss_Translation: INTERNAL AUDIT THERE RESOURCE IDENTIFY BEEN ALSO SUPPORT

English: Internal Audit is responsible for developing and implementing a fraud, bribery and theft awareness plan, giving consideration to the varying needs of elected councillors, staff (including new joiners), contractors and the public served by us to be aware of the risks faced

English: The responsibility for implementing adequate internal controls rests with management

English: We have developed and are committed to systems and procedures which incorporate efficient and effective internal controls and which include adequate separation of duties
